div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of Seventy-six Hindus for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. ) ) ) ) ) ) No. 2532 ORDER DISCHARGING ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE.

The above entitled matter coming on regularly for hearing on the petition, order to show cause why writ of habeas corpus should not issue, return of the Honorable Ellis DeBruler, Commissioner of Immigration, thereto, and the petition for rehearing, and it appearing to the court by such return and by the record of the proceedings of the Bureau of Immigration filed therewith, that the following Hindus named in said petition and order, to-wit: Faizand Alli, Pala Singh and Nyzam Din, were released by said re- spondent and said Bureau prior to the commencement of these proceedings, and that another of said Hindus named in said petition and order, to-wit: Buran Singh, died prior to the cormencement of these proceedings:
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, that as to said four Hindus above named, these proceedings be and the same are hereby dismissed: and the court being fully advised in the premises:

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED, that the petition for the writ of habeas corpus, and the petition for rehearing, be and the same is hereby denied, and that the order to show cause, be and the same is hereby discharged, said denial of the petitions and discharge of the order to show cause being applicable to each of the petitioners, including the other seventy-two Hindus named in said petition and order, to-wit:

Moola Singh, Talok Singh, Dalip Singh, Bhagwan Singh, ala Singh, Rulia Singh, Kishan Singh, Harijan Singh, Arjan Singh, Hire Singh, Bhag Singh, Duvan Singh, Naurang Singh, Dalip Singh, Vir Singh, Ratan Singh, Nama Singh, Bishan Singh, Bishen Singh, Rem Singh, Baboo Singh, Bhagat Singh, Thakar Singh, Variam Singh, Harnam Singh, Gurdit Singh, Kishan Singh, Gurbakhoh Singh, Khazan Singh. Paren Singh, Milkha Singh, Narman Singh, Varian Singh, Sham Singh, Kakoo Singh, Basant Singh, Pooran Singh, Sher Singh, Santa Singh, Harnam Singh, Munshi Singh, Prem Singh, Partap Singh, Naurang Singh, Ahas Ali, Bahader Shah, Mir Ahdylla, Sultan Ali, Bagh Ali, Niaz Mohd, Rahmat Alla, Nayat Khan, Amir Rhan, Amir Khan Mohd Alam, Isay Khan, Amaret Khan, Shali Khar Khan, Nandar Khan, Gulam Nodh, Sanday Khan, Baggn Khan, Umar Den, Ali But, Hanz Mohd, Chiragh Din, Madda Din, Ibrahim Din, Ismail Din, Rahmat Ali, Noor Khan, and Ishar Singh.

And it further appearing to the court that the filing of this order has been delayed by the respondent on the suggestion of the court and in order to give the petitioners opportunity to file with the Bureau of Immigration a bond satisfactory to said Bureau for the release of said petitioners pending an appeal contemplated by them, and their production to answer the order of the court on appeal and that no such bond has been filed, now therefore,

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the order heretofore entered for the holding of said petitioners by respondent to answer the order of court in this proceeding, be and the same is hereby entirely cancelled and dissolved, and said petitioners are left in the custody of respondent and the Bureau of Immigration for deportation or to be otherwise dealt with in accordance with law,

PROVIDED, HOWEVER, that no one of the said petitioners shall be deported pending said appeal for whom there shall have been filed and kept good with said Bureau a satisfactory bond as aforesaid, and for whose maintenance from this date provision has been made as herein set forth, - that is to Say: for each petitioner, whose bond has not yet been filed
and approved as aforesaid, there shall be forthwith deposit- ed with the respondent, or in the registry of this court the sum of six dollars ($6.00) for ten days maintenance of said petitioner, and thereafter, and until said bond shall be furnished and approved as aforesaid, a like sum of six dollars ($6.00) for each ten days, payable in advance. In case said deposits are made into the registry of this oourt there shall be included therewith two percent (2%) extra allowed the clerk of this court by law as compensation for all money deposited in the registry thereof.

An exception is allowed petitioners and each of them to the denial of the writ of habeas corpus herein contained, and to the overruling of petitioner for rehearing, and to the discharge of the order to show cause, and to the rulings herein contained as to the custody of said petition- ers pending said appeal.
Done in open court this 27 day of September, 1913.
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON
In the Matter of the Application of SEVENTY-SIX HINDUS for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
ORDER DISCHARGING ORDER TO SHOW CAUSE.
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington. SEP 29 1913 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Emy Deputy
